newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungarian farmers block roads for third day.
newsitem.headline: Hungarian farmers block roads for third day.

text.p: Hungarian farmers blocked roads for a third day on Wednesday in a protest over tax changes despite reported progress in talks with the government.
National police spokeswoman Eva Kiss said demonstrations were going on at various locations across the country but she did not yet know how many farmers were participating.
The farmers have blocked roads throughout the country with tractors, ploughs, harvesters and other equipment since Monday.
They are protesting at the end of an exemption from social security contributions from January 1 and new requirements to provide documentation for tax purposes.
The protests continued into their third and final scheduled day despite reports of progress in talks held by farmers and a government delegation on Tuesday in the central Hungarian city of Kiskoros.

The farmers and the government delegation headed by Finance Ministry state secretary Tibor Draskovics "reached a common position on about 80 percent of disputed questions", the Hungarian news agency MTI reported.
The three main topics covered in the talks were tax regulations, social security payment obligations and full-time farmer certificates, MTI said.
The farm protests have caused some traffic delays but police generally have managed to route motorists around the blockades and there have been no reports of violence.
